=== Summary of Contributions ===

=== Activities ===
I have be involved with the Ubuntu-ie Loco for many years. I started off by just going along to their events and hanging out and now I am a very active member organizing events.
 I have run lots of events for Ubuntu-ie I will list and list to a few below. 

* I organized a venue for the Global Jam for the last number of years since 09.eg http://www.tog.ie/2010/08/ubuntu-global-jam/ http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/231/detail/
* I have been on the Ubuntu-uk Pod cast to talk about hackerspaces in 09 http://www.tog.ie/2009/10/tog-is-known-across-the-pond/
* I have helped to run release parthys for my loco. 
* I have been the main author of my loco Team reports since August 2009(And not one month missing) https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IrishTeam/TeamReports
* I have given talks at events run by our loco eg Ubunbu talks in UL https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IrishTeam/Events/February-2010-Talks
* Ran a stand at the The Business Value of Open Source Software(With guest speaker Mark Shuttleworth). Blog post
* Run Geek Nicks in the summer months for the loco -> https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-ie/2010-July/000674.html 
* website admin
* mail list mod

=== Future Goals ===
* More non pub events for my loco.
* I really want to put my coding skills to use and contribute to ubuntu.
* To share my knowledge of running events for Ubuntu-ie with new members of the loco and help them run events.
